sen.j: 河越 重員（かわごえ しげかず、生没年未詳）は、鎌倉時代の武蔵国入間郡河越館の武将。
sen.e: Shigekazu KAWAGOE (years of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese military commander of Kawagoe Yakata, Iruma District, Musashi Province in the Kamakura period.

sen.e: Shigefusa KAWAGOE and Shigetoki KAWAGOE were his brothers; Satogozen, a legitimate wife of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, was his sister.

sen.j: 頼朝は重頼の妻である後家尼（比企尼の娘）に旧領を安堵し、領内の名主百姓等に後家尼の下知に従うことを命じた。
sen.e: Yoritomo approved the ownership of their former territory for Shigeyori's wife, a widow of nun (Hikinoama's daughter), and told chief farmers in the territory to follow her order.

sen.j: 元久2年（1205年）6月22日の畠山重忠の乱で、兄河越重時と共に北条義時率いる重忠討伐軍に加わる。
sen.e: In Shigetada HATAKEYAMA Rebellion on June 22, 1205, he joined the army led by Yoshitoki HOJO to defeat Shigetada with his brother Shigetoki KAWAGOE.

sen.j: 承久3年（1221年）6月、承久の乱では北条泰時に従い京都で活躍する。
sen.e: In Jokyu War in June, 1221, he followed Yasutoki HOJO and did remarkable services in Kyoto.

sen.j: 嘉禄2年（1226年）4月10日、鎌倉幕府により重員が武蔵国留守所総検校職に補された。
sen.e: On April 10, 1226, he was appointed as Sokengyo (the chairman of the highest-rank officials of the guild for blind men) of Rusudokoro (the absentee office of the provincial governor) in Musashi Province.

sen.e: On May 14, 1226, he was appointed as Sokengyo (General Superior Officer) of Rusudokoro (the absentee office of the provincial governor) in Musashi Province.

sen.j: ここに河越氏の武蔵での地位が復活した。
sen.e: It is for this reason that the position of the Kawagoe clan in Musashi Province was restored.
